description:
ash: Fix solo window header transparency after workspace switch

Switching between workspaces needs to update the window header transparency
because it may make a single window visible.

BUG=153878
TEST=Added to ash_unittests FramePainterTest.UseSoloWindowHeader


Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=166609

messages.text:
https://codereview.chromium.org/11392003/diff/1/ash/wm/frame_painter.cc
File ash/wm/frame_painter.cc (right):

https://codereview.chromium.org/11392003/diff/1/ash/wm/frame_painter.cc#newcode227
ash/wm/frame_painter.cc:227: Shell::RootWindowList root_windows = Shell::GetAllRootWindows();
do we really need to iterate over all root windows?
The maximize/minimize change will affect only one root window and the workspace manager should know its root, so isn't it enough to call UpdateSoloWindowInRoot() for that root?
Please take another look.  I kept a separate public UpdateSoloWindowHeader(RootWindow* root) so that external modules would not need to know about ignorable windows.

CQ is trying da patch. Follow status at
https://chromium-status.appspot.com/cq/jamescook@chromium.org/11392003/4001

subject: ash: Fix solo window header transparency after workspace switch
